class for an attribute of type ArrayList<Author>.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add additional constructors and setter methods
commitResults.messageBody:
To facilitate restoring data from a file:
- Add AuthorList setter for Tantou class
- Add additional constructor for Manga class
- Add Author setter for Manga class

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Storage singleton with Gson and logging
commitResults.messageBody:
- Allow data to be stored in a JSON file
- Add logging
- Exclude author attribute in Manga from being serialized, preventing
  circular references and infinite recursion in the JSON file
- Implement customer deserializer for Author class to set authors
  manually for each manga

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant methods and refactor AuthorList
commitResults.messageBody:
- Refactor hasAuthor(String) so that it uses a for loop instead of
  calling hasAuthor(Author) with a new Author object instance
- Remove addAuthor & deleteAuthor as they are just add and remove from
  the super class ArrayList
- Remove redundant getAuthorList method as the AuthorList object is
  itself the list
- Propagated the change throughout the whole project

- Rename read and save to file methods
- Call setupDataFile in saveAuthorListToDataFile instead of the
  constructor

commitResults.messageBody:
1. Fix spacing around MangaTantou references

2. Update command format:
- Angle braces `<>` should be used to indicate a compulsory field to
  enter
- Square brackets `[]` should be used to indicate an optional flag to
  enter

3. Also added:
- View command
- Bye command
- Data storage and manual edits to data file
- Command Sumamry
Branch sales parser fix

commitResults.messageTitle: Add custom exceptions for empty lists
Use new empty list exceptions in view commands
Add JUnit tests for view commands
commitResults.messageBody: Also updated testCatalog.json to include sales data.
Branch remove redundant parser checks
Update DG with content regarding Parsing Architecture

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement add author and add manga command - Usage: `add -a [AUTHOR_NAME]` to add author 	 `add -a [AUTHOR_NAME] -m [MANGA_NAME]` to add manga to author - Added basic classes to get us started   - See `exceptions` package for `TantouException`   - See `commands` package for viable `Command`s.   - See `author` package for `Author` and `AuthorList`   - See `manga` package for `Manga`   - See `parser` package for `Parser`. Handles command processing with Apache CLI   - See `constants` package for basic constants to get us started. To expand and add more as we develop.   - See `ui` package for `Ui`. Responsible for getting user input and displaying messages to user.

commitResults.messageBody: Add Donovan to AboutUs.md
Update AboutUs.md (Ian Soukup)

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Parser to only take in arguments enclosed in double quotes - Parser will check the argument following each option to be enclosed in double quotes and will throw an exception otherwise - Introduce Options class to streamline addition of future options - Introduce initalizeOptions method in Parser to iteratively add options to Parser
Update code to comply with checkstyle
Refactor code to minimize arrowhead code

commitResults.messageBody: JUnit Tests for delete functionality

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement JUnit tests for AddAuthorCommand - Tests involve the addition of a new author and the addition of a duplicate author, which   will result in an exception being thrown - Parsing test to ensure that the correct command is being generated also included
Update code to comply with checkstyle

Implement JUnit tests for AddMangaCommand - Tests involve the addition of a new manga and the addition of a duplicate manga   which will result in an exception being thrown - Parser test also updated to check that the correct Command is being generated
Fix typo in test function signature

commitResults.messageBody: Implement JUnit tests for AddAuthorCommand

commitResults.messageTitle: Update command argument to adhere to the other tests
Update test method signatures to follow naming conventions
Update code to comply with checkstyle

commitResults.messageBody: Add assertions and logs for deleteManga and deleteAuthor

commitResults.messageTitle: Introduce assertions and logging for AddAuthorCommand - Assert that userInput is not empty during execute method as that   should be caught at the parser level - Assertions to ensure that the incoming author was properly added - Info and warning logs to inform of existing user and no author provided   respectively - Introduce logger at the Command level, downstream classes will inherit the logger   instance - Fix bug in Parser where in would accept arguments in single quote e.g. add -a "
Introduce assert to verify correct recognization of same authors
Add assertions and logging for AddMangaCommand - Assertions include ensuring that userInput is not empty and   that mangas are added successfully to their corresponding authors
Refactor Options constants - Introduce new delete option - Update deadline option to -b - Introduce require arguments constants
Update validateArgument method - The method should only check for arguments in quotations if the option requires arguments
Update JUnit tests - Tests will now be invoked on catalog instead of add/delete - Deadline related tests are failing
Update Deadline tests to use -b instead of -d
Improve line test coverage for AddAuthorCommand and AddMangaCommand
Improve line test coverage for DeleteAuthorCommand and DeleteMangaCommand
Improve line test coverage for Parser slightly

commitResults.messageBody: Implement adding of sales data to Manga objects

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to fix bug and align with fixes - Discoverd funky behavior of DefaultParser   - DefaultParser strips quotations but not fully, implemented own stripQuotes method   - DefaultParser registers -abug as a valid -a option, verified through debugger walkthrough     which causes bug to be registerd as an argument. Implemented validateSpaceBetweenOptions method     to ensure that flags/options are spaced-out and correctly parsed. - Major refactoring from the use of String userInput and String[] userInputList. Previous iteration   using userInput involved the use of a lot of redundant getUserInputAsList calls
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:AY2425S1-CS2113-T10-3/tp into branch-fixParserBug

Rehaul parsing logic to custom parsing logic - Apache CLI's own parsing logic was not as robust or helpful as the team had thought - Implemented custom parsing logic still based on the same options - Remove Deadline related files as they will also be rehauled by Ian - Improve code defensiveness for catalog related commands - Note that tests have not been updated but the team has decided   to split and work on those parts individually - To improve defensiveness on other parts of the code - "Removed" I/O tests by simplifying to just a bye input
Improve defensiveness of catalog related commands and update relevant tests
Fix Parser to correctly provide values for AddSalesCommand
Update variable namings for improved readability - Introduce extra index constants to avoid the use of magic numbers
Clean up unneccesary code and reorder methods for better readability
Develop puml for adding author scenario
Add developers' iPs to acknowledge structure inspiration
Add user stories for v1.0 pertaining to adding authors and mangas
Refactor argument checking methods for better reusability

Update visibility of Parser methods - The only outward facing method that can be interacted with/invoked should be `getUserCommand` - All other methods are only used by Parser to return an appriopriate command

Update ParserTests to test for defensiveness against poor user inputs in catalog related commands - Introduce additonal custom exceptions to facilitate error identification - Improve line test coverage to 67%

commitResults.messageBody: Update view command parser and add JavaDoc

commitResults.messageTitle: Update genererateExtractorPattern method - The regex which the pattern now returns will only yield the argument for the flag of interest and   will terminate its search upon encountering another known flag - Unknown flags will be treated as part of the argument, to implement an UnknownFlagChecker?

Refactor Parser to improve on SLAP - Introduce utility classes of ArgumentFinder, AuthorArgumentFinder and ArgumentResult to facilitate the parsing of   arguments - ArgumentResult was created as reassginment of Strings is not possible within methods

Implement MangaArgumentFinder - Implement new Manga parsing logic via MangaArgumentFinder and MANGA_NAME_EXTRACTOR_PATTERN - Fix ArgumentFinder bug where merely using the replace method might inadvertently remove hyphenated   letters that were part of other arguments. Now we remove the argument and its corresponding flag via   indexing
Remove unused code and fix tests
